newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: S&P rates CCA US$300 mln eurobond AA-.
newsitem.headline: S&P rates CCA US$300 mln eurobond AA-.

text.p: Ratings agency Standard and Poor's on Thursday said it had assigned its AA- rating to Coca-Cola Amatil Ltd's US$300 million Eurobond issue, which matures on May 28, 2002.
At the same time, S&P affirmed its AA- long-term corporate credit rating on Coca-Cola Amatil (CCA) but said the rating outlook was negative.

"The negative outlook on CCA reflects the strained creditor protection measures for the Coke system, resulting from more than US$2.8 billion of debt-financed acquisitions announced in mid-1996 by Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc., the largest Coke bottler worldwide," S&P said.
S&P said the ratings reflected CCA's strong operational link with U.S.-based major shareholder The Coca-Cola Company ("Coke", rated AA/Negative/A-1+).
They also reflected stable cash flow generation, which was supported by CCA's leading market position in diverse franchise territories and strong brand name.
"These factors are offset by CCA's higher exposure in less-developed offshore markets as well as heightened competition," S&P said.
